qas.question: What is Railway Himachal famous for?
What are the 2 narrow gauge railways in the Railway Himachal?

answers.text: UNESCO World Heritage Kalka-Shimla Railway and another one is Pathankot–Jogindernagar

qas.question: What are the other railways being proposed in the state?
What is being conducted to extend the railway?
What is the total length of the railways?
What is Bilaspur-Manali-Leh railway famous for?

plausible_answers.text: UNESCO World Heritage Kalka-Shimla Railway and another one is Pathankot–Jogindernagar

qas.question: What are the two tunnels in Railway Himachal?
What other railways are being proposed by UNESCO?
What is the total length of the Una district railway?
What is being done to extend the railway line to Delhi?

context: Railway Himachal is famous for <a0_0><b5_0>its narrow gauge tracks railways<b5_0/><a0_0/>, one is <a1_0><b6_0>UNESCO World Heritage Kalka-Shimla Railway and another one is Pathankot–Jogindernagar<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Total length of these two tracks is <a4_0><b8_0>259 kilometres (161 mi)<b8_0/><a4_0/>. Kalka-Shimla Railway track passes through many tunnels, while Pathankot–Jogindernagar gently meanders through a maze of hills and valleys. It also has standard gauge railway track which connect Amb (Una district) to Delhi. <b9_0>A <a3_0>survey<b9_0/><a3_0/> is being conducted to extend this railway line to Kangra (via Nadaun). Other proposed railways in the state are <a2_0><b7_0>Baddi-Bilaspur, Dharamsala-Palampur and Bilaspur-Manali-Leh<b7_0/>.
